thread.title: No-one thought to be inside burning Mangakino house: police
thread.title_full: No-one thought to be inside burning Mangakino house: police

author: Phillipa Yalden
title: No-one thought to be inside burning Mangakino house: police
text:
No-one thought to be inside burning Mangakino house: police PHILLIPA YALDEN Last updated 10:33, February 27 2017 SUPPLIED 
Firefighters arrived to find the Mangakino holiday home engulfed in flames. 
Fears two people were inside a burning rented holiday home were unfounded, police believe. 
It was initially thought two people were inside a bach in Mangakino, north of Taupo, when fire tore through overnight. 
Firefighters were called to the blaze in the three-bedroom Rimu St house at 4.30am on Monday. ROBERT STEVEN/FAIRFAX NZ 
Half the roof of a rental home in Mangakino has collapsed in the fire. 
Two people were staying at the house, Northern Fire Communications shift manager Jaron Phillips said about 5.30am. 
The house was "completely" ablaze. 
At 7.30am Mangakino Fire Chief Craig Snowball said fire crews had been unable to search one part of the "gutted" home where the roof had collapsed onto the house. ROBERT STEVEN/FAIRFAX NZ 
Firefighters initially thought two people may have been inside the holiday home at the time of the fire. 
A car remained parked in the driveway. 
But by 8.30am police released a statement saying it was believed no-one was inside at the time of the fire. 
When firefighters arrived just after 4.30am Snowball said the 100 square-metre bach was engulfed in flames. ROBERT STEVEN/FAIRFAX NZ 
Fire investigators are still trying to find out the cause of the fire. 
Their first concern was to protect the neighbouring home - a mere two metres from the blazing bach. 
"The whole house was on fire, it was pretty close. All we were doing was protecting exposures - the shed out the back and the neighbour's house. 
"There were quite a few people outside when we arrived." ROBERT STEVEN/FAIRFAX NZ 
This house in Rimu St, Mangakino, went up in flames at 4.30am on Monday. 
Once backup arrived, and there were 16 firefighters on site, they dealt with the fire inside the home. 
The home was owned by people from outside Mangakino, Snowball said, but it had been rented out for the week. 
He was still trying to find out the whereabouts of the people who rented the bach. 
Snowball said fire crews were waiting on a fire investigator from Tauranga to arrive before they entered the collapsed section.
